thread.title: ​Maui Brewing Co. opens first Oahu brewpub in Waikiki: Slideshow
thread.title_full: ​Maui Brewing Co. opens first Oahu brewpub in Waikiki: Slideshow

author: Katie Murar
title: ​Maui Brewing Co. opens first Oahu brewpub in Waikiki: Slideshow
text: 15 photos Carissa Wolfe, right, greeter manager, with greeter Shane Baeuerlen preparing to open… more Maui Brewing Co.’s first Oahu location opened Tuesday on the second floor of Outrigger’s Holiday Inn Resort Waikiki Beachcomber in the former Jimmy Buffet’s at the Beachcomber space, serving the company's flagship beers along with traditional pub fare. The 18,000 square-foot Maui Brewing Co. Waikiki , which can seat 435, will be led by Chris Thibaut , CEO of restaurants at Maui Brewing Co., and veteran restaurateur Bill Terry . The kitchen will be led by Executive Chef Terry Lynch . Click on the photos for a slideshow. 15 photos Carissa Wolfe, right, greeter manager, with greeter Shane Baeuerlen preparing to open… more "At Maui Brewing Co., we see ourselves as curators of the craft beer lifestyle and movement in Hawaii, as well as stewards of the community," Thibaut   "We have a great passion for local food and local beer and are proud to open our first Oahu location in partnership with Outrigger, a locally based company whose values closely mirror our own." Sean Dee , executive vice president and chief marketing officer for Outrigger Enterprises Group , which manages the hotel, said in a statement that enhancing the company's properties in Hawaii is a top priority. "We're confident that Maui Brewing Co. will provide a vibrant new experience for our guests and we look forward to toasting to its success," he said. The restaurant, which has 250 employees, was designed by local architecture firm WCIT, and has a 70-foot kinetic wall on the building façade facing Kalakaua Avenue. Founded in 2005 by Garrett and Melanie Marrero , Maui Brewing Co. operates a brewery and tasting room in Kihei as well as its first brewpub in Kahana. The company will open a third brewpub and second Oahu location next year as part of Alexander & Baldwin Inc.’s Lau Hala Shops in the former Macy’s building in Kailua. Katie Murar covers tourism, restaurants, retail and residential real estate for Pacific Business News. Related Content
